intro: Bouvardia perelegans, commonly known as the pink bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive blooms. Bouvardia perelegans is also popular in floral arrangements because of its long-lasting flowers and compact growth habit.
